intro: Manulea campestris, commonly known as the field manulea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Manulea campestris is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil conditions.
